ovdesc.p: This file is used to define the special printer attribute initialisation and reset sequences that are required to be printed with the report in order for it to be printed in Landscape, Portrait mode etc.
The initialisation/reset sequence for each attribute must relate to a printer type that can support it. Hence the key to the file is:
The "Printer type" is the "make" or "model" of the printer, eg. QMS, EPSON etc. This is defined in field 3 of the PRINTER.ID file.
The "Attribute name" is the name referenced in field 7 of the DE.FORM.TYPE file, eg. LANDSCAPE, PORTRAIT etc.

When the report is spooled, the report control system reads the DE.FORM.TYPE record for the report to determine whether any special attribute names have been specified and it also reads the PRINTER.ID record for the destination printer to determine the printer type. The two items are combined to form the key for the PRINTER.ATTRIBUTES file to get the special attribute initialisation/reset sequences for the report.

Printer type and special attribute name. eg. QMS, LANDSCAPE
The record key must be constructed as follows: (i) "Printer type"."Attribute name" or (ii) "Printer type"

The "Printer type" is the "model" or "make" of printer as defined in field 3 of the PRINTER.ID file. For example, ten QMS laser printers would have ten entries on PRINTER.ID but could be collectively referred to as the type "QMS".
The "Attribute name" is the name referenced in field 7 (RPT.ATTRIBUTE) of the DE.FORM.TYPE file.

When a report is spooled, the DE.FORM.TYPE record for the report is read to get the special printer attribute names (if any) and the PRINTER.ID record read to determine the printer type. The initialisation sequence in the PRINTER.ATTRIBUTE file for record "Printer type"."Attribute name" is then sent to the printer before the report is printed.
Examples: QMS.LANDSCAPE This record would define the initialisation/reset sequences to turn the QMS laser printer into Lanscape mode before the report is printed.

QMS This record would define the default initialisation/reset sequences i.e. line spacing etc. for any report sent to this printer which does not have special attributes specified in the DE.FORM.TYPE file.
1-20 type A (alphanumeric) characters.
